Model¶

Model

This script implement the model architecture as published in the publication:

A deep-learning classifier identifies patients with clinical heart failure using whole-slide images of H&E tissue Nirschl JJ, Janowczyk A, Peyster EG, Frank R, Margulies KB, et al. (2018) PLOS ONE 13(4): e0192726. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0192726

created by Jalil Ahmed.

src.Model.conv_block(input_tensor, num_kernels, kernel_size, stride)¶

Create a block of a Convolutional, Batch Normalization, and Activation function layers.

Parameters

  • input_tensor (tensorflow.Tensor) – Input tensor of features

  • num_kernels (int) – Number of kernels in the convolutional layer

  • kernel_size (int) – Size of each kernel

  • stride (int) – Stride of the convolutional layer

Returns

A tensorflow tensor

Return type

tensorflow.Tensor

src.Model.create_model(input_shape=64, 64, 3, num_classes=2, model_name='MODEL_NAME')¶

Create a model based upon the architecture in the publication.

Parameters

  • input_shape ((int, int, int)) – Shape of the input image

  • num_classes (int) – (Default=2) Number of classes

  • model_name (string) – Name of the model

Returns

Convolutional Neural Network

Return type

tensorflow.keras.Model

Nirschl et al Implementation
